page.title: 04 The Misbourne School
page.content: The school was designed by F.Pooley, who was the county architect at that time.It took about 18 months to build. It was opened by Sir David Eccles 29 years ago in January 1956 but there have been many additions since then. Amongst these are three laboratories, an office and a staffroom.Some special rooms are a sports hall,design centre, music rooms and drama studios,computer room,photo studios and a business and information area. The school has about 650 pupils aged 12 to 16 and 100 in the Sixth Form. There are about 45 teachers and about the same number of other staff. As well as learning the normal acedemic subjects,maths,sciences, languages etc.,the pupils can also join in woodwork and metalwork and learn other practical skills.
